intro: Rauvolfia semperflorens, commonly known as the everblooming rauvolfia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are typically glossy and dark green, providing a lush backdrop for its delicate blossoms. Rauvolfia semperflorens is well-suited for shaded or semi-shaded environments and thrives in moist, well-drained soil.
